context_of_use: This use case supports user registration, login, and password recovery to control account access.
description: Support user registration, login, and password recovery to control account access.
triggering_event: User initiates account registration, login, or password reset.
preconditions: User must have valid credentials for login.
postconditions: User account is created upon successful registration.
User is logged in upon successful authentication.
User can reset password and regain access.
assumptions: User has the necessary information to register or reset their password.
User is familiar with the login process.
requirements_met: The system shall allow users to register an account.
The system shall allow users to log in securely.
The system shall allow users to reset their password.
main_flow: 1. User registers account → System creates user account and confirms registration.
2. User logs in → System authenticates user and grants access.
3. User requests password reset → System sends password reset instructions.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the user provides invalid registration information, the system prompts for correct information.
AF-2 (from Step 2): If the user provides incorrect login credentials, the system notifies the user of the failure.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): If the system fails to send password reset instructions, the system notifies the user of the error.
